renewReport.explainOther: If you want to file a report for someone else, please use another phone, tablet or computer.

report.title: Report
report.intro: Help fighting against the new Coronavirus in India by self-reporting your health status.
report.contract: Did you contract Covid-19 and recovered?
report.notSick: Great! Stay at home even if you're not sick to avoid propagation.
report.contracted: Regarding your recent social contacts, do you think you contracted Covid-19?
report.contractedOfficialConfirmText: Have you been officially tested positive to Covid-19 by a recognized medical institution?
report.locationValidError: Please enter a valid Indian postal number
report.errorDetails: An error occurred when sending your data
report.sentComeBack: Thank you for your contribution. Please come back if your health status changes.
report.sentSomeoneElse: If you want to file a report for someone else, please use another phone, tablet or computer.
report.sentMistake: You've made a mistake ? You can correct it :

visualize.title: Visualize
visualize.dataWarning: The following data is community collected and not verified.

about.title: About
about.headWho: This project is developed by a team of Switzerland developers.
about.who: They open sourced it to the world to help other countries. Now, it is maintained by an intenational team to bring this to India. The aim is to deliver the community driven data collection to the public. This information provides the current situation of the COVID-19 pandemia in India.
about.needYou: Our app is based on your self-reporting. That means only if you provide data this app can show more real data about other areas. So it is important that all of you provide your health data and then update your health status if it changed during the course of lockdown
about.headData: We don’t save any personal information in our servers!
about.data: Every data is anonymous but to keep our datasets consistent, we need that you use always the same browser to update your status (otherwise you will be counted twice).
about.headDataUpdate: Is this data updated Realtime, well...no!
about.dataUpdate: Currently, it is not supported. If we get enough support, we will bring this feature to you. We will provide update of the numbers as frequently as we can.
about.headPublicData: Want to use our data or join us?
about.publicData: Our dataset is public and open in our github organization https://github.com/ch-covid-19/datasets-ind. Please use it to make your own awesome visualization.
about.dataCare: Keep in mind that our dataset is based on self-reporting from peoples thus the data are not official and could contains errors. The data is only intended to be used as an indicator.
about.improvement: of improvement or you want to report an error, please contact on Facebook.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.goalQuestion: What is the goal of this app?
faq.goalResponse: We aim to provide a visualization of the progression of the {disease} pandemic in our country. How can we 'flatten the curve' without having a statistical idea of the current situation? Help us by publishing your health status.
faq.othersQuestion1: How do I report other members of my family?
faq.othersResponse1: We are working on this issue. For now, you can use a different device (e.g., phone, tablet, computer) or a different browser (e.g., chrome, firefox, opera, safari) for each member of your family. Please do not use incognito function as you cannot recover the session later to update your health status.
faq.othersQuestion2: Do you store any personal data of mine e.g., phone number, name, house address?
faq.othersResponse2: No, we do not store any personal data. As this is developed for Switzerland which follows high privacy standards no personal data is collected. We use browser cookies to identify your session.
faq.othersQuestion3: Is this data official data confirmed by Govt. of India?
faq.othersResponse3: No, this is not official data confirmed by the Govt. For official data please check: www.mohfw.gov.in. Another open source effort for collecting officially confirmed cases is: https://www.covid19india.org
faq.othersQuestion4: How can I contribute to your work?
faq.othersResponse4: You are welcome to join our community effort in github organization: https://github.com/ch-covid-19/welcome. Currently, we are desperately looking for volunteers who can bring this platform to the people e.g., social media manager, media contact persons, etc. You do not need coding knowledge to help us. You could help just by contacting right people, replying to comments in Twitter and Facebook. We are Looking forward having many volunteers
faq.othersQuestion5: Can I donate some money to run the infrastructure costs?
faq.othersResponse5: You are welcome. We expect the traffic to grow. Currently, we are using the free credits given by Google Cloud. We need your support. You can contact us via the following email: prabhakaran1989@gmail.com to contribute to India hosting
faq.othersQuestion6: How about the security of the website, can someone write a script to add invalid data?
faq.othersResponse6: That is a great question. We have taken necessary security precautions such as the following: We used industry standard Google Capcha v3 verification monitor suspicious behaviour and to prevent from such attacks. We also believe that hackers are also humans and therefore will not ethically involve in such actions.
